Email/Password Authentication Use an email and password to authenticate with Firebase. Passwordless Authentication Use only an email to authenticate with Firebase. Phone Number Authentication Use a phone number to authenticate with Firebase. Anonymous Authentication Sign in anonymously and then later upgrade to a full Firebase Auth user. Custom Authentication Use a custom token signed by your own server to authenticate with Firebase. FirebaseUI Auth Use the FirebaseUI-Android library to authenticate with Firebase. Frequent Asked question

How do I contact Eldoret Water & Sanitation Company Ltd?

Physical Address: Kampi Somali Rd, off Oloo Street
Box: 8418-30100 ELDORET,Kenya
Phone: 053-2061915, 2063403, Fax: 053-2063556
Toll Free Line: 0800-211-155
Mobile: +254 072455538
Website: www.eldowas.or.ke
Email: info@eldowas.or.ke
Twitter: @eldowasco
Facebook: Eldowas Page

Or contact our Customer Care Offices located at;

  1. Eastern Office - Opposite AP Quarters street Next to KIP Plaza
  2. Western Office - SGA building Opposite Muchai Estate
  3. Southern Office - Opposite Hill School, Reformed Church Buildings
  4. Kesses Office – Kesses

How do I get connected to water and/Sanitation services?

All water connections MUST be applied for by the Land Lord/property owner. You will need to contact Eldoret Water & Sanitation customer care offices near you for more information.

How do I pay for the services/bill?

The company no longer receives cash payments. You can pay for the services through the following pay-points;

  • M-Pesa Paybill No. 511000;
  • Standard Chartered Bank A/C No. 0152017704300;
  • Equity Bank- A/C No. 0300294625495;
  • KCB-A/C No.118128184;
  • Co-op Bank A/C No. 01148685815500

Can I read my own meter?

Yes. Customers are encouraged to read their meters especially as soon as they receive their current bill to enable them track their consumptions. However, denying authorized staff access to read the meter is illegal.

How do I launch a complaint?

Pay a visit to any of our customer service centres and the customer care staff will assist you lodge in your complaint. Thereafter you will receive a reference number for ease of follow up.

How does ELDOWAS deal with illegal connections?

The company has put in place a monitoring unit to check on illegal connections. Anyone found using water illegally will be prosecuted. The company also encourages its customers to report any suspected illegal connections. ELDOWAS promises to protect the reporters’ anonymity.

What do I need to do if the service has been disconnected

In the event that the service has been removed, you will have to show proof of payment by making full payment of the outstanding balance and a reconnection fee of KES 1,000.00, before the service is restored.

Am I allowed to reconnect my water after the service has been disconnected?

No. According to the Water Act 2002, it is a criminal offense to reconnect your own water.

What are the monthly mandatory standing charges applicable to the service?

As per the current approved water tariff, the charges are as follows; Water KES 210.00, Sewer KES 157.50, Meter rent KES 50.00 and cleansing KES 40.00. These charges are payable to any active account and are subject to change.

What should I do if I suspect that my meter has stopped working/faulty?

Immediately report to the company and the meter will be serviced or replaced free of charge. However, one will be required to pay for a new meter if found to have willfully damaged or tampered with it.

Are there charges for reading or servicing the meter?

No. The company staff will read the meter on a monthly basis free of charge. However if a customer feels the bill is too high even though the meter reading is correct, one can pay a meter testing fee of KES 500.00.

How do I conserve water to avoid wastage or high bills?

As the saying goes, “Water is life.” Do not leave the taps dripping or running. Fix leaks immediately and replace a leaking tap/meter. Re-use water instead of pouring it down the drain. Install a simple rain water harvesting system to harvest water during the rainy season.

How do I obtain or pass any information to ELDOWAS relating to the services?

ELDOWAS has installed a 24/7 customer care line 0724255538 or Toll Free Line: 0800-211-155 to enable our customers reach us. However, one can also pay us a visit at our customer care centres or write or email us at info@eldowas.or.ke

How Do I report contaminated water?

Customers are encouraged to immediately call our customer service centre on 072455538 or Toll Free Line: 0800-211-155 or report to any of our ELDOWAS customer Service Centres near you. Our technical team will attend to the issue within 24 hrs. One can also deliver a water sample to our Quality Assurance section located at the head office for testing.
